alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Maricopa; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 22 at 8:31PM MST until June 22 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... East central La Paz County in west central Arizona... Northeastern Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 915 PM MST. * At 831 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Wenden to 13 miles south of Salome to 14 miles east of Kofa Wildlife Refuge, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 34 and 83. US Highway 60 between mile markers 35 and 66. AZ Route 72 between mile markers 37 and 49. Locations impacted include... Salome, Brenda, Vicksburg Junction, Wenden, Kofa Wildlife Refuge, Vicksburg and Harcuvar. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
